intro: Klingia, commonly known as the snowbell, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. These plants are native to the Arctic and subarctic regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including parts of North America, Europe, and Asia. Klingia species are typically low-growing shrubs with small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. They thrive in cold, rocky environments and are often found in tundra or alpine habitats. The genus is characterized by its hardy nature and ability to survive in harsh climatic conditions.
